poem:
### Crisis Refrain

The narrow bed  
where healing laid,  
disrupted now—a shift;  
whispers of missiles  
in early light.

Vacant hallways  
echo with urgency,  
the balm displaced  
by marching boots,  
pulsing the rhythm  
of a world  
at war.

Among the ruins,  
fragile breath awaits,  
cradled in the hands  
of waiting dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Houthis claim missile attack on Tel Aviv after Israel strikes Yemen airport – Middle East crisis live 9.44am GMT Israeli forces demand evacuation of staff and patients at Kamal Adwan hospital - report The Israeli military demanded that medical staff and patients leave the premises of Kamal Adwan hospital to make room for their forces to storm the facility, Palestinian news agency Wafa reported this morning. Gaza’s health ministry has said the three main hospitals". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
